content:
I've been working on a library of results in the mathematical theory of interest called Interest.
So far it includes results on the existence of a unique solution for any of these given the others:

  • present value of an annuity
  • future value
  • periodic payment (equivalently, coupon rate for a bond)
  • prevailing interest rate (yield)
  • Macaulay duration
  • maturity date of a bond

In order to deduce the maturity date and the yield rate from the Macaulay duration I made use of Aristotle by Harmonic, which saved a lot of time.

Critiques welcome. Submit your PR to the Interest repo today :)
